brown_fat_cool_home.title: Brown fat and a cool home environment
brown_fat_cool_home.description: Brown fat helps the body burn energy and generate heat. Spending time in a cool indoor environment, ideally below 21°C (70°F), can stimulate brown fat activity and increase energy expenditure. Lowering the temperature at home occasionally may support metabolism and metabolic health.

areas.energy: Activation of brown fat increases energy expenditure and may support better metabolic health.

colorful_vegetables_anthocyanins.title: Eat a variety of colorful vegetables
colorful_vegetables_anthocyanins.description: Eating vegetables in a variety of colors, especially dark and red ones rich in anthocyanins, provides a broad spectrum of antioxidants and phytonutrients. Anthocyanins, found in foods like blueberries, red cabbage, and beets, have been shown to support heart health, reduce inflammation, and protect cells from oxidative stress. Vary your vegetable colors to maximize health benefits.

areas.nutrition: Colorful vegetables provide different vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants that strengthen the immune system and promote overall health.

eat_colorful_veggies.title: Eat colorful vegetables
eat_colorful_veggies.description: Eating vegetables in a variety of colors provides a broad spectrum of antioxidants and nutrients. Vary the colors on your plate to support digestion and immune function.

areas.digestiveHealth: Colorful vegetables support gut health and digestion.
areas.immuneSupport: Different colors provide different antioxidants that strengthen the immune system.

vitamin_d.title: Vitamin D
vitamin_d.description: Vitamin D levels can vary based on factors such as sun exposure, diet, and geographic location. Pairing D3 with complementary vitamin K2 helps route calcium to bones and protects soft tissues. Consider adding magnesium bisglycinate to support vitamin D activation and efficient calcium uptake.

areas.energy: Vitamin D supports mitochondrial function and cellular energy production by regulating calcium homeostasis.
areas.immuneSupport: Vitamin D modulates both innate and adaptive immune responses, with low levels associated with increased infection susceptibility.
areas.strength: Vitamin D is critical for muscle strength and function through calcium regulation and muscle protein synthesis pathways.
areas.stressReduction: Vitamin D influences neurotransmitter production and has neuroprotective effects in the central nervous system.

fattyFish.name: Fatty fish (salmon, mackerel, sardines)
fattyFish.details: Aim for a 120 g serving of salmon or mackerel 2-3 times per week (~400-600 IU vitamin D).

eggYolks.name: Egg yolks
eggYolks.details: Two egg yolks supply roughly 80-100 IU vitamin D.

fortifiedDairy.name: Fortified dairy or plant milks
fortifiedDairy.details: A 250 ml glass of fortified milk or plant milk delivers about 100-130 IU vitamin D.

mushrooms.name: Sun-exposed mushrooms
mushrooms.details: 100 g sun-exposed mushrooms can provide roughly 400 IU vitamin D.

vitamin_e_antioxidant_support.title: Vitamin E for antioxidant defense
vitamin_e_antioxidant_support.description: Vitamin E shields cell membranes from oxidative stress and supports cardiovascular resilience. Mixed tocopherols and tocotrienols cover a wider spectrum than alpha-tocopherol alone, making them useful when inflammatory or lipid stress is high. Combining with carotenoids like astaxanthin offers complementary membrane protection. Large doses of isolated alpha-tocopherol can crowd out other E forms, so stay near label guidance unless you are using mixed complexes.

areas.immuneSupport: Vitamin E enhances immune cell signaling and protects lipids in cell membranes from peroxidation.
areas.cardioFitness: Adequate vitamin E helps maintain endothelial function and balances oxidative load during exercise.
areas.energy: By preserving mitochondrial membranes, vitamin E supports efficient energy production under stress.

coq10.title: Mitokondrienäring
coq10.description: Vissa näringsämnen är involverade i mitokondriella processer relaterade till cellulär energiproduktion.

areas.energy: CoQ10 spelar en kritisk roll i den mitokondriella elektrontransportkedjan, vilket är avgörande för cellulär energiproduktion.
areas.immuneSupport: CoQ10 har antioxidantegenskaper som hjälper till att skydda celler från oxidativ stress och stödjer immunsystemets funktion.

coq10.analyzePrompt: Analysera bilden och bestäm mitokondriens behov av stöd.

organMeats.name: Organ meats (heart, liver)
organMeats.details: An 85 g serving of beef heart or liver supplies around 10-15 mg CoQ10.

fattyFish.name: Fatty fish (sardines, mackerel)
fattyFish.details: 120 g sardines or mackerel delivers roughly 6 mg CoQ10.

beef.name: Beef and bison
beef.details: 120 g lean beef offers about 3 mg CoQ10.

spinach.name: Spinach
spinach.details: 1 cup cooked spinach (~180 g) provides about 2 mg CoQ10.

broccoli.name: Broccoli
broccoli.details: 1 cup steamed broccoli (~150 g) yields roughly 1 mg CoQ10.

cellular_energy_nad.title: NAD+
cellular_energy_nad.description: NAD+ (Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide) is a critical coenzyme found in every cell of the body. It plays a key role in cellular energy metabolism, DNA repair, and maintaining overall cellular health. Precursors such as NMN, NR, or foundational niacin can sustain NAD+ levels when direct supplementation is not preferred.

areas.energy: NAD+ is essential for the mitochondrial processes that generate ATP, the primary energy currency of the cell.
areas.stressReduction: NAD+ supports the nervous system by aiding in cellular repair and protecting neurons from oxidative stress.
areas.immuneSupport: NAD+ contributes to immune function by supporting cellular metabolism and repair mechanisms vital for immune cells.

cellular_energy_nad.analyzePrompt: Analyze the user's NAD+ levels and suggest strategies to optimize cellular energy metabolism.

sleep_timing_circadian.title: Sleep timing and circadian rhythm
sleep_timing_circadian.description: Synchronizing sleep with the body's natural circadian rhythm optimizes sleep quality and recovery. Consistent sleep and wake times help regulate hormone production and metabolism.

areas.sleepQuality: Regular sleep rhythm improves sleep quality by strengthening the body's natural melatonin production.
areas.immuneSupport: Circadian synchronization supports immune function by optimizing the body's natural defense cycles.
areas.energy: Consistent sleep schedule regulates energy levels and reduces daytime fatigue.

calm_alertness_ltheanine.title: L-Theanine for calm focus
calm_alertness_ltheanine.description: L-Theanine is an amino acid naturally found in green tea. It promotes relaxation without drowsiness and enhances focus by increasing alpha brain waves and balancing neurotransmitters like GABA, dopamine, and serotonin.

areas.mind: L-Theanine improves concentration and attention while reducing stress and promoting a state of calm alertness.

neurotransmitter_ltyrosine.title: L-Tyrosine for mental performance
neurotransmitter_ltyrosine.description: L-Tyrosine is an amino acid that serves as a precursor to dopamine, norepinephrine, and adrenaline. It supports cognitive function, focus, and mental performance, especially during stressful situations.

areas.mind: L-Tyrosine improves concentration, attention, and cognitive performance by increasing the production of key neurotransmitters.

maintain_hydration.title: Maintain hydration
maintain_hydration.description: Consistent daily fluid intake supports circulation, temperature regulation, and immune defense function. Adequate hydration is fundamental for all bodily functions.

areas.immuneSupport: Hydration supports immune defense by promoting lymph circulation and nutrient transport to cells.
areas.energy: Adequate fluid maintains energy levels and reduces fatigue by optimizing cellular metabolism.
areas.cardioFitness: Hydration improves cardiovascular performance by maintaining blood volume and oxygen transport.

vitamin_c_immunity.title: Vitamin C for immunity
vitamin_c_immunity.description: Vitamin C is a water-soluble vitamin found in fruits and vegetables. It is a powerful antioxidant that supports the immune system and protects cells from oxidative stress.

areas.immuneSupport: Vitamin C strengthens immune defense by supporting white blood cells and increasing the body's resistance to infections.

citrusFruits.name: Citrus fruits (oranges, grapefruit, lemon)
citrusFruits.details: One medium orange (~130 g) yields about 70 mg vitamin C.

berries.name: Berries (strawberries, blackcurrants)
berries.details: 1 cup mixed berries (~150 g) supplies roughly 80 mg vitamin C.

bellPeppers.name: Bell peppers
bellPeppers.details: Half a cup raw red pepper (~75 g) gives about 95 mg vitamin C.

kiwi.name: Kiwi fruit
kiwi.details: One large kiwi (~75 g) provides about 70 mg vitamin C.

fermentedCabbage.name: Fermented cabbage (sauerkraut, kimchi)
fermentedCabbage.details: Half a cup sauerkraut (~70 g) offers around 20 mg vitamin C.

echinacea_herbs.title: Echinacea for immune support
echinacea_herbs.description: Echinacea is a flowering plant traditionally used to support immune function. It contains active compounds that may help the body's natural defense mechanisms and has been studied for its potential to reduce the duration and severity of common colds.

areas.immuneSupport: Echinacea stimulates immune cell activity and may help the body respond more effectively to infections and support overall immune resilience.

calming_glycine.title: Calming amino acids
calming_glycine.description: Glycine is an amino acid that acts as a neurotransmitter in the central nervous system. It has been studied for its calming effects and its role in promoting relaxation and better sleep.

areas.stressReduction: Glycine acts as an inhibitory neurotransmitter, helping to calm the nervous system and reduce stress.
areas.sleepQuality: Glycine has been shown to improve sleep quality by promoting relaxation and regulating body temperature.
areas.immuneSupport: Glycine supports immune function by reducing inflammation and promoting cellular repair.

boneBroth.name: Bone broth
boneBroth.details: A 250 ml cup of long-simmered bone broth gives about 2-3 g glycine.

collagenCuts.name: Collagen-rich cuts (brisket, shank)
collagenCuts.details: 120 g braised brisket or shank supplies roughly 3 g glycine-rich collagen.

skinOnPoultry.name: Skin-on poultry
skinOnPoultry.details: 100 g roasted chicken with skin provides about 2 g glycine.

porkRinds.name: Pork rinds or cracklings
porkRinds.details: 30 g pork rinds contain around 2.5 g glycine.

legumes.name: Legumes (soy, beans, lentils)
legumes.details: 1 cup cooked soybeans or lentils (~180 g) offers about 2 g glycine.

breathwork_parasympathetic.title: Breathwork techniques
breathwork_parasympathetic.description: Breathwork is a powerful tool for activating the parasympathetic nervous system, reducing stress, and promoting relaxation. Different breathing techniques can be used for specific outcomes such as calm, focus, or better sleep.

areas.stressReduction: Controlled breathing directly activates the parasympathetic nervous system, reducing stress hormones and promoting relaxation.
areas.immuneSupport: Regular breathwork can improve immune function by reducing chronic stress and promoting better sleep and recovery.
areas.energy: Proper breathing techniques enhance oxygen utilization and energy levels throughout the day.

box_breathing.title: Box breathing
box_breathing.description: Box breathing (also called square breathing) is a technique where you inhale, hold, exhale, and hold again for equal counts (typically 4-4-4-4). It's excellent for rapid stress relief and focus.

areas.stressReduction: Box breathing creates a balanced rhythm that quickly activates the parasympathetic nervous system.
areas.immuneSupport: Regular practice helps reduce cortisol levels and supports immune resilience.

4_7_8_breathing.title: 4-7-8 breathing
4_7_8_breathing.description: The 4-7-8 technique involves inhaling for 4 counts, holding for 7 counts, and exhaling for 8 counts. It's particularly effective for relaxation and sleep preparation.

areas.stressReduction: The extended exhale activates the vagus nerve, promoting deep relaxation and reducing anxiety.
areas.sleepQuality: This technique is highly effective for preparing the body and mind for sleep, improving sleep quality.

alternate_nostril_breathing.title: Alternate nostril breathing
alternate_nostril_breathing.description: Nadi Shodhana (alternate nostril breathing) involves breathing through one nostril at a time in a controlled pattern. It balances the nervous system and enhances mental clarity.

areas.stressReduction: This technique balances the left and right sides of the nervous system, promoting harmony and calm.
areas.mind: Alternate nostril breathing enhances mental clarity and concentration by balancing brain hemispheres.

diaphragmatic_breathing.title: Diaphragmatic breathing
diaphragmatic_breathing.description: Also called belly breathing or deep breathing, this technique focuses on breathing deeply into the abdomen rather than the chest. It's fundamental to all breathwork practices.

areas.stressReduction: Deep diaphragmatic breathing significantly reduces stress and anxiety by activating the relaxation response.
areas.energy: Proper oxygenation through diaphragmatic breathing improves energy levels and mental clarity.

sleep_optimization_recovery.title: Sleep optimization for recovery
sleep_optimization_recovery.description: Quality sleep is fundamental for physical recovery, immune function, mental clarity, and overall health. Sleep optimization involves multiple factors including duration, consistency, environment, and pre-sleep routines.

areas.stressReduction: Quality sleep supports nervous system recovery and balance between sympathetic and parasympathetic systems.
areas.immuneSupport: Sleep is crucial for immune function and the body's ability to fight infections and heal.
areas.energy: Adequate sleep restores energy levels and optimizes the body's metabolic processes.
areas.cardioFitness: Sleep supports cardiovascular health by regulating blood pressure and heart rate.
areas.sleepQuality: Optimized sleep habits improve sleep quality, deep sleep, and REM sleep for maximum recovery.

sleep_duration_consistency.title: Sleep duration and consistency
sleep_duration_consistency.description: Getting 7-9 hours of consistent sleep each night is crucial for nervous system recovery, hormonal balance, and cellular repair. Maintaining a consistent sleep schedule helps regulate your circadian rhythm.

areas.sleepQuality: Consistent 7-9 hours of sleep allows for complete sleep cycles, including deep sleep and REM sleep necessary for memory consolidation and emotional processing.
areas.energy: Adequate sleep duration directly impacts energy levels, cognitive function, and physical performance throughout the day.

sleep_environment_optimization.title: Sleep environment optimization
sleep_environment_optimization.description: Creating an optimal sleep environment is essential for quality sleep. This includes darkness, cool temperature, quiet conditions, and comfortable bedding that support restorative sleep.

areas.sleepQuality: A dark, cool (60-67°F), quiet environment promotes melatonin production and deeper sleep cycles.
areas.stressReduction: An optimized sleep environment reduces external stressors and allows the nervous system to fully relax and recover.

sleep_hygiene_practices.title: Sleep hygiene practices
sleep_hygiene_practices.description: Sleep hygiene encompasses daily habits that promote better sleep, such as avoiding caffeine in the afternoon, limiting screen time before bed, and maintaining regular exercise routines.

areas.sleepQuality: Good sleep hygiene practices remove barriers to quality sleep and create conditions for deeper, more restorative rest.
areas.immuneSupport: Quality sleep from good hygiene practices strengthens immune function and supports the body's ability to fight infections.

pre_sleep_wind_down.title: Pre-sleep wind-down routine
pre_sleep_wind_down.description: A structured wind-down routine 30-60 minutes before bed signals to your body that it's time to sleep. This can include relaxation techniques, light reading, meditation, or gentle stretching.

areas.sleepQuality: A proper wind-down routine helps transition the nervous system from wakefulness to sleep, promoting faster sleep onset and deeper sleep.
areas.stressReduction: Pre-sleep relaxation techniques activate the parasympathetic nervous system, preparing the body for restorative sleep.

sunlight_circadian.title: Morning sunlight exposure
sunlight_circadian.description: Exposure to natural sunlight, especially within 30-60 minutes of waking, is crucial for regulating circadian rhythm and optimizing sleep-wake cycles. Morning light suppresses melatonin and signals the start of the day.

areas.sleepQuality: Morning sunlight exposure helps set your circadian clock, improving sleep quality and making it easier to fall asleep at night.
areas.stressReduction: Natural light exposure regulates the nervous system by synchronizing circadian rhythms and supporting balanced cortisol production.
areas.energy: Morning sunlight boosts alertness and energy levels throughout the day by signaling to your body that it's time to be awake.
areas.immuneSupport: Regular circadian rhythm from sunlight exposure supports immune function and overall health.

cold_exposure_ans.title: Cold exposure therapy
cold_exposure_ans.description: Deliberate cold exposure, such as cold showers, ice baths, or cold plunges, activates the sympathetic nervous system and builds stress resilience. Regular cold exposure improves immune function, increases energy, and enhances mental clarity.

areas.stressReduction: Cold exposure trains the nervous system to handle stress by activating and then balancing the sympathetic and parasympathetic responses.
areas.immuneSupport: Regular cold exposure has been shown to increase white blood cell count and strengthen immune function.
areas.energy: Cold exposure boosts dopamine and norepinephrine levels, leading to increased alertness, energy, and mood elevation.

meditation_mindfulness.title: Meditation and mindfulness
meditation_mindfulness.description: Regular meditation and mindfulness practices train the mind to stay present and reduce stress. These practices activate the parasympathetic nervous system, improve emotional regulation, and enhance cognitive function.

areas.stressReduction: Meditation activates the parasympathetic nervous system, reducing stress hormones like cortisol and promoting deep relaxation and nervous system recovery.
areas.immuneSupport: Regular meditation has been shown to reduce inflammation, strengthen immune response, and improve overall health markers.
areas.mind: Mindfulness practices improve attention span, working memory, and cognitive flexibility by strengthening neural pathways associated with focus and awareness.

nature_parasympathetic.title: Time in nature
nature_parasympathetic.description: Spending time in natural environments activates the parasympathetic nervous system and reduces stress. Forest bathing (Shinrin-yoku) and exposure to natural settings have been shown to lower cortisol, reduce blood pressure, and improve overall well-being.

areas.stressReduction: Nature exposure activates the parasympathetic nervous system, reducing stress hormones and promoting relaxation and recovery.
areas.immuneSupport: Time in nature has been shown to boost natural killer cell activity and strengthen immune function.
areas.energy: Natural environments restore mental energy, reduce fatigue, and improve mood through exposure to natural light and fresh air.

hrv_recovery_monitoring.title: HRV and recovery monitoring
hrv_recovery_monitoring.description: Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is a key metric for tracking nervous system balance and recovery status. Monitoring HRV helps optimize training intensity, prevent overtraining, and ensure adequate recovery between workouts.

areas.stressReduction: HRV reflects the balance between sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous system activity, indicating stress and recovery levels.
areas.immuneSupport: Low HRV can indicate increased inflammation and reduced immune function, while higher HRV suggests better recovery and immune resilience.
areas.energy: HRV tracking helps identify when the body needs rest, preventing fatigue and optimizing energy management.
areas.cardioFitness: Monitoring HRV helps optimize cardiovascular training by ensuring adequate recovery between high-intensity sessions.
areas.strength: HRV data guides training decisions, helping prevent overtraining and optimize muscle recovery and performance gains.

social_connection_vagal.title: Social connection and vagal tone
social_connection_vagal.description: Positive social interactions and meaningful relationships activate the vagus nerve and strengthen parasympathetic tone. Social connection is essential for nervous system regulation, emotional well-being, and overall health.

areas.stressReduction: Positive social interactions activate the vagus nerve, improving heart rate variability and promoting parasympathetic nervous system activation.
areas.immuneSupport: Strong social connections have been shown to reduce inflammation, strengthen immune function, and increase longevity.
areas.energy: Meaningful relationships and social support reduce stress and improve energy levels by lowering cortisol and enhancing emotional resilience.

calming_music_waves.title: Calming music and sound therapy
calming_music_waves.description: Listening to calming music, binaural beats, or nature sounds can reduce stress, lower heart rate, and activate the parasympathetic nervous system. Sound therapy has been used for centuries to promote relaxation and healing.

areas.stressReduction: Calming music and sound therapy activate the parasympathetic nervous system, reducing stress hormones and promoting deep relaxation.
areas.sleepQuality: Listening to calming sounds before bed can improve sleep onset, increase deep sleep duration, and enhance overall sleep quality.
areas.mind: Certain frequencies like binaural beats and nature sounds can enhance concentration, reduce mental fatigue, and improve cognitive performance.

adaptogenic_herbs.title: Adaptogenic herbs
adaptogenic_herbs.description: Adaptogens are herbs and mushrooms that help the body adapt to stress and promote balance. They support energy, endurance, and overall wellbeing.

areas.stressReduction: Adaptogenic herbs support the nervous system by modulating the stress response and promoting mental and physical resilience.

neuromuscular_training.title: Neuromuscular training concepts
neuromuscular_training.description: Neuromuscular training focuses on improving the connection between the nervous system and muscles to enhance strength, coordination, and overall performance.

areas.strength: Neuromuscular training enhances muscle strength and coordination, improving physical performance.
areas.cardioFitness: This training supports cardiovascular fitness by improving endurance and oxygen utilization during physical activity.
areas.stressReduction: Neuromuscular training strengthens the communication between the nervous system and muscles, optimizing movement efficiency.

creatine_atp_strength.title: Creatine
creatine_atp_strength.description: Creatine is a naturally occurring compound that supports ATP production, the primary energy source for muscle contractions and brain function. It enhances strength, power output, mental clarity, and muscle recovery during intense training.

areas.strength: Creatine increases phosphocreatine stores in muscles, enhancing ATP production and improving strength and power output during high-intensity exercise.
areas.energy: Creatine supports cellular energy production by replenishing ATP more rapidly, sustaining energy during intense physical activity.
areas.cardioFitness: Creatine may support cardiovascular endurance by improving oxygen utilization and reducing fatigue during sustained aerobic activities.
areas.mind: Creatine supports brain energy metabolism and cognitive function, improving mental clarity, focus, and memory.

creatine_atp_strength.warning: Creatine supplementation may affect kidney function in individuals with pre-existing conditions.

betaalanine_endurance.title: Beta-alanine for endurance
betaalanine_endurance.description: Beta-alanine is a non-essential amino acid that increases carnosine levels in muscles, buffering lactic acid and delaying fatigue during high-intensity exercise. It's particularly effective for activities lasting 1-4 minutes.

areas.strength: Beta-alanine increases muscle carnosine levels, reducing fatigue and improving performance during high-intensity exercise.
areas.cardioFitness: By buffering lactic acid, beta-alanine extends endurance capacity and allows for longer, more intense cardiovascular training sessions.

shilajit_performance.title: Shilajit for performance
shilajit_performance.description: Shilajit is a mineral-rich substance found in the Himalayas that supports mitochondrial function, enhances energy production, and improves physical performance. It contains fulvic acid and over 85 minerals in ionic form.

areas.strength: Shilajit supports muscle recovery, reduces exercise-induced muscle damage, and enhances strength and endurance.
areas.energy: Shilajit boosts mitochondrial ATP production, increasing cellular energy and reducing fatigue during physical activity.
areas.cardioFitness: Shilajit improves oxygen utilization and cardiovascular efficiency, enhancing aerobic capacity and endurance performance.

probiotics_microbiota.title: Probiotics and gut microbiota
probiotics_microbiota.description: Probiotics are beneficial bacteria that support gut health, strengthen the immune system, and improve nutrient absorption. A healthy gut microbiome is essential for overall health, mood regulation, and disease prevention.

areas.digestiveHealth: Probiotics restore and maintain healthy gut bacteria balance, improving digestion, reducing bloating, and supporting intestinal barrier function.
areas.immuneSupport: About 70% of the immune system resides in the gut. Probiotics strengthen immune function, reduce inflammation, and protect against pathogens.

yogurt.name: Yogurt
yogurt.details: 200 ml live-culture yogurt delivers roughly 5-10 billion CFU.

kefir.name: Kefir
kefir.details: 200 ml kefir offers about 10-20 billion CFU with diverse strains.

sauerkraut.name: Sauerkraut
sauerkraut.details: Half a cup raw sauerkraut (~70 g) supplies live lactic acid bacteria.

kimchi.name: Kimchi
kimchi.details: Half a cup kimchi (~85 g) provides probiotics plus prebiotic vegetables.

miso.name: Miso
miso.details: One tablespoon miso stirred into warm (not boiling) broth preserves enzymes.

fiber_microbiome.title: Fiber and microbiome health
fiber_microbiome.description: Dietary fiber acts as a prebiotic, feeding beneficial gut bacteria and supporting a healthy microbiome. Adequate fiber intake improves digestive health, reduces inflammation, and strengthens immune function.

areas.digestiveHealth: Fiber promotes regular bowel movements, feeds beneficial bacteria, and supports gut barrier integrity by producing short-chain fatty acids.
areas.immuneSupport: A fiber-rich diet strengthens the gut microbiome, which produces metabolites that regulate immune function and reduce systemic inflammation.

oats.name: Oats and barley
oats.details: Half a cup dry rolled oats (~40 g) gives around 4 g beta-glucan fiber.

legumes.name: Legumes (lentils, chickpeas, beans)
legumes.details: 1 cup cooked beans or lentils (~180 g) supplies about 15 g fiber.

chiaSeeds.name: Chia or flax seeds
chiaSeeds.details: Two tablespoons chia seeds (~28 g) deliver roughly 10 g fiber.

berries.name: Berries
berries.details: 1 cup raspberries (~120 g) provides about 8 g fiber.

cruciferousVeg.name: Cruciferous vegetables (broccoli, Brussels sprouts)
cruciferousVeg.details: 1 cup steamed broccoli or cauliflower (~150 g) offers around 5 g fiber.

milk_thistle_liver.title: Milk thistle for liver health
milk_thistle_liver.description: Milk thistle contains silymarin, a powerful antioxidant that protects liver cells, supports detoxification, and promotes liver regeneration. It's particularly beneficial for liver health and digestive function.

areas.digestiveHealth: Milk thistle supports bile production and liver function, improving fat digestion and overall digestive health.
areas.immuneSupport: By supporting liver detoxification, milk thistle reduces toxic burden on the body and strengthens overall immune resilience.

hiit_vo2max.title: HIIT for VO2 max
hiit_vo2max.description: High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) is one of the most effective methods to improve VO2 max, the maximum amount of oxygen your body can use during exercise. HIIT enhances cardiovascular fitness, mitochondrial density, and metabolic efficiency.

areas.cardioFitness: HIIT training significantly increases VO2 max, improving cardiovascular capacity, endurance, and overall aerobic fitness.
areas.energy: HIIT boosts mitochondrial biogenesis, increasing cellular energy production and improving metabolic efficiency throughout the day.

running_volume_aerobic.title: Running volume for aerobic capacity
running_volume_aerobic.description: Consistent running volume at moderate intensity builds aerobic base, improves cardiovascular efficiency, and enhances fat metabolism. Long, steady runs develop capillary density and improve oxygen delivery to muscles.

areas.cardioFitness: Regular running volume strengthens the heart, increases stroke volume, and improves overall cardiovascular endurance and aerobic capacity.
areas.energy: Aerobic running improves fat oxidation, enhances mitochondrial function, and increases sustained energy levels for daily activities.

multivitamin_general.title: Multivitamin
multivitamin_general.description: A multivitamin provides essential vitamins and minerals that support overall health, energy, and vitality. It can help fill nutritional gaps in the diet.

areas.energy: Multivitamins support energy production by providing B-vitamins and minerals necessary for cellular metabolism.
areas.immuneSupport: Vitamins and minerals in multivitamins strengthen the immune system and help the body defend against infections.

magnesium.title: Magnesium
magnesium.description: Magnesium is an essential mineral that plays a vital role in muscle relaxation, nervous system function, and sleep quality. It helps the body regulate stress hormones and promotes deeper, more restorative sleep.

areas.sleepQuality: Magnesium improves sleep quality by regulating melatonin and promoting muscle relaxation.
areas.stressReduction: Magnesium supports the nervous system by regulating neurotransmitters and reducing stress.
areas.energy: Magnesium is necessary for energy production and reduces fatigue by supporting ATP synthesis.

leafyGreens.name: Dark leafy greens (spinach, chard, kale)
leafyGreens.details: 1 cup cooked spinach (~180 g) provides about 150 mg magnesium.

pumpkinSeeds.name: Pumpkin or sunflower seeds
pumpkinSeeds.details: 30 g roasted pumpkin seeds give around 150 mg magnesium.

almonds.name: Almonds and other nuts
almonds.details: 30 g almonds contribute roughly 80 mg magnesium.

darkChocolate.name: Dark chocolate (70-85% cacao)
darkChocolate.details: 30 g 70-85% cacao dark chocolate supplies about 65 mg magnesium.

blackBeans.name: Black beans, chickpeas, or lentils
blackBeans.details: 1 cup cooked black beans (~170 g) yields about 120 mg magnesium.

avocado.name: Avocado
avocado.details: One medium avocado offers roughly 60 mg magnesium.

zinc_comprehensive_support.title: Zinc for immune resilience
zinc_comprehensive_support.description: Zinc is a trace mineral critical for immune defense, tissue repair, and hormone balance. Highly absorbable forms can help maintain resilience during stress and intense training.

areas.immuneSupport: Zinc supports innate and adaptive immunity by regulating cytokine signaling and white blood cell activity.
areas.stressReduction: Adequate zinc helps maintain neurotransmitter balance, supporting mood and stress tolerance.
areas.energy: Zinc is required for hundreds of enzymatic reactions linked to energy metabolism and recovery.

oysters.name: Oysters
oysters.details: Three medium oysters deliver about 30 mg zinc.

beef.name: Beef and lamb
beef.details: A 120 g portion of beef provides roughly 5 mg zinc.

pumpkinSeeds.name: Pumpkin seeds
pumpkinSeeds.details: 30 g pumpkin seeds add about 2-3 mg zinc.

chickpeas.name: Chickpeas and lentils
chickpeas.details: 1 cup cooked chickpeas (~170 g) gives around 2.5 mg zinc.

cashews.name: Cashews
cashews.details: 30 g cashews supply roughly 1.6 mg zinc.

selenium_thyroid_antioxidant.title: Selenium for thyroid and antioxidant defense
selenium_thyroid_antioxidant.description: Selenium powers glutathione-based antioxidant enzymes and supports the conversion of thyroid hormones, helping maintain immunity, energy, and stress tolerance.

areas.immuneSupport: Selenium supports antibody production and regulates inflammation, bolstering immune resilience.
areas.energy: Selenium-dependent enzymes activate thyroid hormones that drive metabolic energy and mitochondrial efficiency.
areas.stressReduction: Selenium protects neurons from oxidative stress and supports balanced mood and stress responses.

brazilNuts.name: Brazil nuts
brazilNuts.details: One Brazil nut delivers 60-90 mcg selenium; limit to 1-2 per day.

sardines.name: Sardines and salmon
sardines.details: 100 g sardines provide about 45 mcg selenium.

eggs.name: Eggs
eggs.details: Two eggs supply roughly 28 mcg selenium.

shiitakeMushrooms.name: Shiitake mushrooms
shiitakeMushrooms.details: 100 g cooked shiitake mushrooms give around 20 mcg selenium.

sunflowerSeeds.name: Sunflower seeds
sunflowerSeeds.details: 30 g sunflower seeds add about 18 mcg selenium.

iodine_thyroid_balance.title: Iodine for thyroid balance
iodine_thyroid_balance.description: Iodine supplies the raw material for thyroid hormones, helping maintain metabolic drive, immune resilience, and clear thinking.

areas.energy: Adequate iodine keeps T3 and T4 production robust, sustaining metabolic energy throughout the day.
areas.immuneSupport: Balanced thyroid hormones modulate immune signaling and help the body respond appropriately to stressors.
areas.stressReduction: Iodine supports nervous system stability by maintaining hormone balance that affects mood, focus, and thermoregulation.

seaweed.name: Seaweed (kombu, nori, wakame)
seaweed.details: One 5 g sheet of dried seaweed can supply 150-300 mcg iodine; use sparingly.

iodizedSalt.name: Iodized salt
iodizedSalt.details: Half a teaspoon of iodized salt provides close to 150 mcg iodine.

dairy.name: Dairy products
dairy.details: A 250 ml glass of milk or yogurt delivers about 50 mcg iodine.

eggs.name: Eggs
eggs.details: Two eggs provide roughly 50 mcg iodine.

cod.name: Cod and other white fish
cod.details: A 120 g cod fillet offers about 110 mcg iodine.

betaine_cardiovascular.title: Betaine
betaine_cardiovascular.description: Betaine supports cardiovascular function and physical performance.

ashwagandha_adaptogen.title: Ashwagandha
ashwagandha_adaptogen.description: Ashwagandha is an adaptogenic herb traditionally used in Ayurvedic medicine. It helps the body manage stress by supporting cortisol balance and promoting relaxation.

areas.stressReduction: Ashwagandha supports the nervous system by reducing stress and promoting calm through cortisol regulation.
areas.energy: Ashwagandha helps combat fatigue and supports sustained energy levels throughout the day.
areas.immuneSupport: Ashwagandha has immune-modulating properties that support overall immune health.

rhodiola_adaptogen.title: Rhodiola
rhodiola_adaptogen.description: Rhodiola is an adaptogenic herb known for enhancing mental and physical performance. It helps the body adapt to stress and supports cognitive function.

areas.stressReduction: Rhodiola supports the nervous system by reducing mental fatigue and improving stress resilience.
areas.energy: Rhodiola enhances physical endurance and reduces fatigue during demanding activities.
areas.mind: Rhodiola improves cognitive function, focus, and mental clarity, especially under stress.

holy_basil_adaptogen.title: Holy Basil (Tulsi)
holy_basil_adaptogen.description: Holy Basil, also known as Tulsi, is an adaptogenic herb revered in traditional medicine for its stress-reducing and immune-supporting properties.

areas.stressReduction: Holy Basil helps calm the nervous system and reduce stress through its adaptogenic effects.
areas.immuneSupport: Holy Basil supports immune function with its antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.

cordyceps_adaptogen.title: Cordyceps
cordyceps_adaptogen.description: Cordyceps is a medicinal mushroom known for its energy-boosting and performance-enhancing properties. It supports cellular energy production and endurance.

areas.energy: Cordyceps enhances cellular energy production by supporting mitochondrial function and ATP generation.
areas.cardioFitness: Cordyceps improves oxygen utilization and cardiovascular endurance during physical activity.
areas.immuneSupport: Cordyceps has immune-modulating effects that support overall immune health.

zone2_mitochondrial_base.title: Zone 2 for a mitochondrial base
zone2_mitochondrial_base.description: Zone 2 training builds your aerobic foundation by increasing mitochondrial density, capillarization, and fat oxidation. The goal is a steady, conversational pace where you can speak in full sentences and keep intensity stable over time.

areas.cardioFitness: Zone 2 improves aerobic capacity through increased stroke volume, higher capillary density, and more efficient oxygen delivery to working muscles.
areas.energy: Consistent Zone 2 supports mitochondrial biogenesis and improves energy metabolism, leading to more sustainable energy during training and daily life.

zone2_mitochondrial_base.analyzePrompt: Analyze the user's training pattern and determine whether they have enough low-intensity aerobic volume (Zone 2) to support mitochondrial development.

fasted_aerobic_training.title: Fasted aerobic training
fasted_aerobic_training.description: Low-intensity training with low glycogen availability (e.g., before breakfast) can stimulate fat metabolism and mitochondrial adaptations. Use selectively and primarily in Zone 2 — not for hard intervals.

areas.energy: Training with low glycogen availability may improve fat oxidation and stimulate mitochondrial signaling pathways linked to endurance adaptation.
areas.cardioFitness: When kept low intensity, this can improve aerobic robustness without compromising quality in high-intensity sessions when periodized correctly.

lactate_threshold_training.title: Threshold training for 10K–10 miles
lactate_threshold_training.description: Threshold training (tempo just below lactate threshold) makes you faster without accumulating fatigue as quickly. It’s a key driver for 10K and longer races because you can sustain a high pace with controlled effort.

areas.cardioFitness: Threshold sessions raise the pace you can sustain before lactate accumulates too quickly, improving race performance over 5–10K distances.
areas.energy: Improved lactate clearance and more efficient energy systems let you produce more work with less perceived fatigue at higher speeds.

lactate_threshold_training.analyzePrompt: Analyze the user's current fitness and recommend a threshold structure (e.g., 20–40 minutes continuous or broken into blocks) that matches their capacity.

running_economy_drills.title: Running economy: technique, drills, and strides
running_economy_drills.description: Running economy is how little energy you need for a given pace. Short technique drills and strides (brief controlled accelerations) improve neuromuscular efficiency so you can run faster at the same effort.

areas.strength: Strides and drills improve force application and elastic recoil, making your stride more efficient and feel ‘lighter’.
areas.stressReduction: Short speed exposures train coordination and muscle fiber recruitment, improving movement efficiency.
areas.cardioFitness: Better running economy lowers the oxygen cost at a given pace, improving endurance performance.

stride_frequency_optimization.title: Cadence and stride frequency
stride_frequency_optimization.description: Optimizing cadence (stride frequency) can reduce braking forces and improve running economy. For many runners, an efficient cadence often falls around 170–185 steps/min at moderate to higher speeds, but the optimal cadence is individual.

areas.strength: A more efficient cadence can reduce overload by lowering impact per step and improving control of stride length.
areas.stressReduction: Cadence work improves rhythm, coordination, and timing, increasing movement efficiency.
areas.energy: Improved mechanics can reduce energy ‘leaks’ and help you hold pace at a lower overall energy cost.

caffeine_endurance_performance.title: Caffeine for endurance and speed
caffeine_endurance_performance.description: Caffeine can improve performance by increasing alertness, lowering perceived effort, and supporting higher output during hard sessions. It’s especially useful before intervals, threshold runs, and races.

areas.energy: Caffeine can increase performance by influencing adenosine receptors and improving work capacity under effort.
areas.mind: Boosts alertness and mental sharpness, which can improve pacing and discomfort tolerance during tough intervals.
areas.cardioFitness: By improving effort tolerance, you can sustain higher intensity longer, strengthening the training stimulus for VO2 and threshold.

nitrate_no_efficiency.title: Nitrates (beetroot) for oxygen efficiency
nitrate_no_efficiency.description: Dietary nitrates from beetroot can increase nitric oxide (NO), improving blood flow and muscular oxygen efficiency. Often used as a performance aid before hard sessions or races.

areas.cardioFitness: Higher NO availability can improve blood flow and reduce oxygen cost at a given intensity, potentially benefiting 5–10K performance.
areas.energy: Improved muscular efficiency can increase output per liter of oxygen and reduce energy loss at higher workloads.

l_carnitine_fat_transport.title: L-carnitine and fat transport
l_carnitine_fat_transport.description: L-carnitine is involved in transporting fatty acids into mitochondria. Effects on endurance vary between individuals and are more likely to appear with longer-term use alongside a well-structured training and nutrition plan.

areas.energy: Supports pathways involved in fat metabolism and may contribute to more efficient energy supply at low-to-moderate intensity.
areas.cardioFitness: In some cases, it may support endurance by improving fat utilization and reducing glycogen stress during longer sessions.

sauna_mitochondrial_adaptation.title: Sauna for recovery and endurance adaptation
sauna_mitochondrial_adaptation.description: Heat exposure (such as sauna) can act as a hormetic stressor and support heat adaptation, circulation, and recovery. Many endurance athletes use sauna as a training adjunct, especially during higher-volume phases.

areas.energy: Heat can stimulate stress-response pathways and cellular adaptation, supporting resilience and recovery when dosed appropriately.
areas.cardioFitness: Heat acclimation can improve plasma volume and circulatory efficiency, potentially supporting endurance and heat tolerance.

cold_exposure_timing.title: Cold exposure: timing for performance
cold_exposure_timing.description: Cold exposure can increase alertness and stress resilience, but doing it immediately after hard training may interfere with adaptation signals in some cases. The strategy is to time cold exposure to support recovery without ‘stealing’ training gains.

areas.strength: Smart timing can let you use cold for perceived recovery without unnecessarily blunting strength and growth signaling.
areas.cardioFitness: Cold can be used for nervous system regulation and resilience, but should be periodized around key workouts to preserve training quality.

co2_tolerance_breathing.title: CO₂ tolerance and breathing for running
co2_tolerance_breathing.description: CO₂ tolerance influences breathing drive and how efficiently you ventilate at higher intensities. Breathing control and gradual CO₂ exposure can reduce perceived breath stress and improve running economy for some people.

areas.cardioFitness: Better breathing control can improve ventilation patterns and reduce ‘panic breathing’ at high intensity, supporting endurance performance.
areas.energy: More efficient breathing work can reduce the energy cost of ventilation and free capacity for working muscles.

astaxanthin_recovery_antioxidant.title: Astaxanthin for recovery
astaxanthin_recovery_antioxidant.description: Astaxanthin is a powerful fat-soluble antioxidant that protects cell and mitochondrial membranes from oxidative stress. Pairing it with vitamin E tocotrienols delivers the strongest complementary membrane protection; mixed tocopherols are a solid fallback when tocotrienols are unavailable. When used with proper timing, it can improve recovery, reduce exercise-induced muscle damage, and support endurance performance.

areas.strength: Astaxanthin may reduce oxidative muscle damage and delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS), supporting faster recovery between training sessions.
areas.energy: By protecting mitochondria from oxidative stress, astaxanthin can help maintain more stable cellular energy production over time.
areas.cardioFitness: Astaxanthin may support endurance by improving fat metabolism and reducing oxidative load during longer aerobic efforts.

astaxanthin_recovery_antioxidant.analyzePrompt: Analyze the user's training intensity and recovery demands to determine whether astaxanthin is appropriate, and when it should be used relative to hard training sessions.

avoid_flat_hard_shoes.title: Avoid hard flat shoes on flat surfaces
avoid_flat_hard_shoes.description: Wearing hard, flat shoes on flat ground can increase stress on the body, joints, muscles, and nervous system. Choose shoes with some cushioning or vary the surface to reduce overload risk and support more natural movement.

areas.strength: Avoiding hard flat shoes reduces unnecessary strain on muscles and tendons.
areas.stressReduction: Varying surfaces and footwear supports nervous system adaptability.

near_infrared_red_light.title: Near Infrared / Red Light
near_infrared_red_light.description: Near infrared and red light are used for recovery, energy support, and muscle health.

areas.energy: Supports energy production and recovery.
areas.strength: May improve muscle health and recovery.

far_infrared_light.title: Far Infrared
far_infrared_light.description: Far infrared is used for deep tissue warming and recovery.

areas.energy: Promotes deep warming and energy support.

nasal_breathing_nitric_oxide.title: Nasal Breathing and Nitric Oxide
nasal_breathing_nitric_oxide.description: Breathing through the nose increases nitric oxide (NO) production, which dilates blood vessels, improves oxygen uptake, and supports cardiovascular health. Nasal breathing can also reduce stress and improve energy levels.

areas.energy: Nasal breathing improves oxygen uptake and can boost energy.
areas.cardioFitness: Nitric oxide from nasal breathing dilates blood vessels and supports cardiovascular health.

lutein_zeaxanthin_eye_health.title: Lutein and Zeaxanthin for Eye Health
lutein_zeaxanthin_eye_health.description: Lutein and zeaxanthin are antioxidants that protect the eyes from harmful light and may reduce the risk of age-related macular degeneration. Found in kale, spinach, and egg yolk.

areas.energy: Supports eye energy metabolism and protection.

msm_joint_health.title: MSM for Joint Health
msm_joint_health.description: MSM (methylsulfonylmethane) is a sulfur-containing compound that may reduce joint pain and support recovery. Commonly used for joint issues and to reduce inflammation. There is some research and user experience suggesting that MSM may reduce inflammation in the gut, support mucosal health, and contribute to better digestion. MSM is sometimes used for IBS and other gastrointestinal issues. MSM may also contribute to stronger hair and improved hair growth.

areas.recovery: May help speed up recovery from joint issues.
areas.immuneSupport: Has anti-inflammatory properties that support immune health.
